task_summary: The robot arm turns on the kitchen faucet by approaching, grasping, and rotating its knob.

task_long_description.overview: In this episode, a robot arm interacts with a toy kitchen faucet mounted on a countertop. Its goal is to turn on the faucet by identifying, approaching, and operating the faucet knob using a pinch grasp. The sequence involves visual localization of the knob, precise alignment, actuation (rotating the knob in the 'open' direction), and releasing the knob after rotation. The scene includes typical kitchen fixtures, with the robot performing the manipulation without visible obstructions.
preconditions: Faucet present and accessible on countertop
Robot arm initialized and in reach of faucet
stepwise_plan: Locate the faucet knob using vision
Grasp the knob securely with a pinch
success_criteria: Knob rotated by at least 45 degrees in 'open' direction
Knob actuation is completed without collision
Faucet is visually confirmed to be in 'on' state or flowing
failure_and_recovery: Knob not visible: re-scan with multiple attempts
Grasp unsuccessful: retry alignment and grasp
Arm collision or blocked: halt and retreat
task_long_description.termination: Behavior ends after retreat following knob rotation and release.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if the faucet knob is visible with the robotâ€™s sensors.
Scans for the faucet knob in the scene using a raster search pattern.
Detects and localizes the faucet knob precisely.
Moves the robot end-effector above the faucet knob.
Approaches and aligns the gripper with the faucet knob within tight tolerance.
Executes pinch grasp to secure faucet knob with minimum force.
Turns faucet knob by 45 degrees in the open direction using minimal force.
Releases faucet knob by opening the gripper.
Safely retreats robot arm from the faucet after actuation.

failure_modes: Insufficient force or incomplete knob rotation
recovery_strategy: Retry knob scan and detection up to 3 times
Abort and retreat if excessive resistance or collision detected
assumptions: Instruction does not define whether faucet is a lever or knob; frames confirm knob type, plan reflects knob actuation.
Frames show no actual water flow; success inferred from knob rotation.
Contact-sheet confirms robot does not place object below faucet, only manipulates knob.
